com.ibm.zrl.idmx.dm
Class CommitmentOpening

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.zrl.idmx.dm.Commitment
      com.ibm.zrl.idmx.dm.CommitmentOpening
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CommitmentOpening
extends Commitment
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is a sub-class of Commitment. We store the opening information consisting of the message value(s) m and the random value r used to compute the commitment's value. The commitment value is stored in the super-class along with the bases and modulus.

See Also:
Commitment, Serialized Form

                         java.math.BigInteger random,
                         java.math.BigInteger modulus,
                         int l_n)
Constructor.

Parameters:
message - Message value (i.e., commitment exponent).
random - Random value.
capR_0 - Base for the message.
capS - Randomization base.
modulus - Modulus.
l_n - Bit length of the modulus.

                         IssuerPublicKey issuerPublicKey)
Constructor.

Parameters:
message - Message value.
random - Random value.
issuerPublicKey - Issuer public key used to retrieve bases and modulus (i.e., Z, S and n).

CommitmentOpening

public CommitmentOpening(java.util.Vector<java.math.BigInteger> messages,
                         java.math.BigInteger random,
                         IssuerPublicKey issuerPublicKey)
Multi-base commitment opening constructor, which creates a single commitment to many messages.

Parameters:
messages - Value of the messages (i.e., the commitment exponents).
random - Random value.
issuerPublicKey - Issuer public key used to retrieve bases and modulus (i.e., Z, S and n).

getCommitmentObject

public final Commitment getCommitmentObject()
Returns:
Commitment object. Once a prover has setup the CommitmentOpening, he can create a Commitment in order to send to the verifier.

verifyCommitment

public final boolean verifyCommitment()
Verify if the generated value in the commitment object is correct to ensure the prover and verifier have the same commitment (only useful for debugging).

Returns:
True if re-computed commitment equals the stored commitment.

genRandom

public static java.math.BigInteger genRandom(java.math.BigInteger n,
                                             int l_n)
To get a random value specifically for commitment computations. We can't squirrel this into the constructors since we need to put the random value into a final private field. Hence the client must explicitly pass the random value generated with this method.

Parameters:
n - RSA modulus.
l_n - Bit length of the modulus.
Returns:
random value.
